Rogctable 0.1.0
  • Get started
  • Reference

    Rogctable

    Uses packages ocg-p, datatool, tikz and booktabs to create sortable table with LaTeX output. Built on PDF Layers (Optional Content Groups (OCG)): only works with Acrobat Reader, Foxit Reader, PDF-XChange-Viewer or Evince.

    Usage

    You must import the package ocg-p, datatool, tikz, booktabs and colortbl, for example using:

    header-includes:
   - \usepackage{ocg-p,datatool,tikz,booktabs,colortbl}

    The results='asis' must be used in the chunks. Then you just need to use the function ogc_table with cat:

    library(Rogctable)
d1 = head(iris)
cat(ogc_table(d1),
    sep = "\n")

    Download the PDF, open it and click on the columns!
